abstract: Editorial praises Canadian Prime Min Justin Trudeau for introducing national plan to reduce greenhouse gas emissions by putting price on carbon, which helped achieve critical mass required to put Paris climate agreement into effect; urges United States officials to heed example of Canadian provinces who have already shown that carbon tax does not necessarily impede production or burden citizens.

keywords.value: Carbon Caps and Emissions Trading Programs
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: The prime minister’s plan to put a price on carbon emissions is a significant environmental step, and leaves provinces with choices on how to carry it out.
